intro: Camptandra angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf camptandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of eastern North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Camptandra angustifolia is often found in the understory of forests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
